meshIneBits

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • meshIneBits.Layer

  • public class Layer
extends java.util.Observable
    A layer contains all the bit 3D for a given Z. These bits are organized following a PatternTemplate. In order to build the 3D bits, it has to start by building a Pavement for each slice. The referentialPavement determines the position and orientation of the bits. It is then cloned and shaped to fit the linked Slice.

        Returns:

      • moveBit

        public Vector2 moveBit(Vector2 bitKey,
                       Vector2 direction)
        Move a bit. The distance of displacement will be determined in dependence on the pattern template. Not use in quick succession because after each move, the layer will be recalculated, slowing the process
        Parameters:
        bitKey - origin of bit
        direction - the direction in local coordinate system of the bit
        Returns:
        the new origin of the moved bit

      • rebuild

        public void rebuild()
        Rebuild the whole layer. To be called after every changes made on this layer

      • replaceBit

        public Vector2 replaceBit(Bit3D bit,
                          double percentageLength,
                          double percentageWidth)
        Scale a bit
        Parameters:
        bit - extruded bit
        percentageLength - 0 to 100
        percentageWidth - 0 to 100
        Returns:
        the key of the replaced bit. If percentageLength or percentageWidth is 0, the bit will be removed instead.
